metalign.voice.hmm

Class HmmVoiceSplittingModelState

  • java.lang.Object
    • metalign.generic.MidiModelState
      • metalign.voice.VoiceSplittingModelState
        • metalign.voice.hmm.HmmVoiceSplittingModelState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<MidiModelState>

    public class HmmVoiceSplittingModelState
extends VoiceSplittingModelState
    A State contains a List of the Voices which are currently present in the HMM as well as its cumulative probability so far.
    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 7 April, 2015

    • Field Summary

        Parameters:
        incoming - A List of the MidiNotes on which we need to transition.

      • getAllCandidateNewStatesRecursive

        private java.util.TreeSet<HmmVoiceSplittingModelState> getAllCandidateNewStatesRecursive(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> openVoiceIndices,
                                                                                         java.util.List<MidiNote> incoming,
                                                                                         java.util.List<Voice> newVoices,
                                                                                         double logProbSum,
                                                                                         int noteIndex)
        This method does the work for handleIncoming(List) recursively.
        Parameters:
        openVoiceIndices - The open voice indices for each note, gotten from getOpenVoiceIndices(List, List) initially.
        incoming - A List of incoming notes.
        newVoices - A List of the Voices in this State as it is now. For each recursive call, this should be a deep copy since the Voices that lie within will be changed.
        logProbSum - The sum of the current log probability of this State, including any transitions already made recursively.
        noteIndex - The index of the note which we are tasked with transitioning on.
        Returns:
        A List of all States which could be transitioned into given the parameters.

      • addNewVoicesRecursive

        private void addNewVoicesRecursive(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> openVoiceIndices,
                                   java.util.List<MidiNote> incoming,
                                   java.util.List<Voice> newVoices,
                                   double logProbSum,
                                   int noteIndex,
                                   double[] newVoiceProbs,
                                   double maxValue,
                                   java.util.TreeSet<HmmVoiceSplittingModelState> newStates)
        This method does the work for getAllCandidateNewStatesRecursive(List, List, List, double, int) of adding the notes into newly created voices.
        Parameters:
        openVoiceIndices - The open voice indices for each note, gotten from getOpenVoiceIndices(List, List) initially.
        incoming - A List of incoming notes.
        newVoices - A List of the Voices in this State as it is now. For each recursive call, this should be a deep copy since the Voices that lie within will be changed.
        logProbSum - The sum of the current log probability of this State, including any transitions already made recursively.
        noteIndex - The index of the note which we are tasked with transitioning on.
        newVoiceProbs - The probability of adding the current note into a new voice at any given index.
        maxValue - The maximum value of any number in newVoiceProbs.
        newStates - The States List where we will add the newly created States.

      • addToExistingVoicesRecursive

        private void addToExistingVoicesRecursive(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> openVoiceIndices,
                                          java.util.List<MidiNote> incoming,
                                          java.util.List<Voice> newVoices,
                                          double logProbSum,
                                          int noteIndex,
                                          double[] existingVoiceProbs,
                                          java.util.TreeSet<HmmVoiceSplittingModelState> newStates)
        This method does the work for getAllCandidateNewStatesRecursive(List, List, List, double, int) of adding the notes into existing voices.
        Parameters:
        openVoiceIndices - The open voice indices for each note, gotten from getOpenVoiceIndices(List, List) initially.
        incoming - A List of incoming notes.
        newVoices - A List of the Voices in this State as it is now. For each recursive call, this should be a deep copy since the Voices that lie within will be changed.
        logProbSum - The sum of the current log probability of this State, including any transitions already made recursively.
        noteIndex - The index of the note which we are tasked with transitioning on.
        existingVoiceProbs - The probability of adding this note into an existing voice at each index.
        newStates - The States List where we will add the newly created States.

      • getOpenVoiceIndices

        private java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> getOpenVoiceIndices(java.util.List<MidiNote> incoming,
                                                                              java.util.List<Voice> voices)
        Get a List of the indices at which open voices are in the given List of Voices.
        Parameters:
        incoming - A List of the MidiNotes which occur at the given onset time.
        voices - A List of the Voices we want to check.
        Returns:
        A List of the open voices in newVoices for each incoming note. return.get(i).get(j) will return the index of the (j+1)th (since it is 0-indexed) open Voice in newVoices for the ith note from incoming.

      • reverseTransition

        private void reverseTransition(int transition,
                               java.util.List<Voice> newVoices)
        Reverse the given transition.
        Parameters:
        transition - The transition we want to reverse.
        newVoices - The Voices List where we want to reverse the transition.

      • doTransition

        private void doTransition(MidiNote note,
                          int transition,
                          java.util.List<Voice> newVoices)
        Perform the given transition WITHOUT calculating probability.
        Parameters:
        note - The note we want to add to a Voice.
        transition - The value of the transition we want to perform on the given note. A negative value tells us to add the note to a new Voice placed at index (-transition - 1). Any non-negative value means to add the note into the Voice at that index in newVoices.
        newVoices - A List of the Voices available to have notes added to them.

      • getTransitionProb

        private double getTransitionProb(MidiNote note,
                                 int transition,
                                 java.util.List<Voice> newVoices)
        Get the probability of the given transition occurring.
        Parameters:
        note - The note we want to add to a Voice.
        transition - The value of the transition we want to perform on the given note. A negative value tells us to add the note to a new Voice placed at index (-transition - 1). Any non-negative value means to add the note into the Voice at that index in newVoices.
        newVoices - A List of the Voices available to have notes added to them.
        Returns:
        The probability of the given transition.

        Parameters:

      • getScore

        public double getScore()
        Description copied from class: MidiModelState
        Get the score of this MidiModelState. In general, a higher score reflects that a State is more likely given our prior knowledge. The natural ordering of MidiModelStates is based on this score value.
        Specified by:
        getScore in class MidiModelState
        Returns:
        The score of this MidiModelState.
